review_preview: We had an amazing experience at Burnout! We were initially standing outside the restaurant to look at the menu for the following day and we were invited in to the restaurant just to experience the atmosphere and enjoy their delicious potato chips. Little did we...
review_full: We had an amazing experience at Burnout! We were initially standing outside the restaurant to look at the menu for the following day and we were invited in to the restaurant just to experience the atmosphere and enjoy their delicious potato chips. Little did we know we were greeted by their amazing chef, Aldo! When we shared that my fiance was vegetarian he invited us to come back the following day and although a vegetarian burger is not on the menu, he said he would make one for us! We came back and had an even better experience. He created a black bean burger for my fiance from scratch that was filling and so delicious. I had a burger from the menu and it was also cooked to perfection, with great fries, and some of the best guacamole I've ever had. Everything on their menu is made fresh, and that was evident with the first bite into my burger and guacamole. We also had nachos and the chili was also delicious. In addition to the great food, the staff was just wonderful, they were friendly, and SO accommodating. We asked if they had sangria, they didn't have any but they made a fresh glass for us! The restaurant overall has a cool and chill vibe. They have some great art on the walls and good music. I would absolutely recommend this place!  This restaurant is a perfect example of Ask and you shall receive!

review_preview: My partner and I were standing in front of Burnout deciding whether we wanted to enter when Chef Aldo welcomed us in and offered us water and chips at no cost. We started chatting with him and when I told him I couldn't eat there...
review_full: My partner and I were standing in front of Burnout deciding whether we wanted to enter when Chef Aldo welcomed us in and offered us water and chips at no cost. We started chatting with him and when I told him I couldn't eat there because I'm a vegetarian, he promised to make me a veggie burger if we returned the following day. We returned the following day and as promised, he purchased ingredients to make me a veggie burger and they made us sangria (although it's not on the menu). The food was so fresh and delicious. My partner loved her burger and fries. We also had carrot cake and it was the best carrot cake I've ever had! Chef Aldo and his colleagues made us feel loved and welcomed. Although it was a burger and fries at a burger joint, the service was comparable to the service I received at top steakhouses in NYC. If we return to Madrid, we're definitely going to Burnout at Calle Valverde 6! Thanks Aldo!!!

title_review: Fantastic Burgers with Fantastic service in Gran Via Madrid!
review_preview: As a family of four which includes our two teenagers, we was looking for somewhere to eat near to  hotel Indigo on Gran Via, that did good burgers. I did a search on TripAdvisor and came across "BURNOUT". Valverde, 6 Madrid.The  restaurateur Aldo and...
review_full: As a family of four which includes our two teenagers, we was looking for somewhere to eat near to hotel Indigo on Gran Via, that did good burgers.  I did a search on TripAdvisor and came across "BURNOUT". Valverde, 6 Madrid. The  restaurateur Aldo and his colleague made us feel very welcome as soon as we put our feet across the threshold.  Burnout has just recently reopened after under going a refurbishment. It has a really nice ambience.  The burgers were cooked to perfection. You will not be disappointed Aldo will Make sure of that! The Oreo milkshake was better than the English versions. The vinto tinto and beer were refreshingly good.  Make sure you leave room for the delicious dessert. We had Aldo's own freshly baked carrot cake, chocolate brownie cake and ice cream. The adults finished off with a very strong Apértif We rolled out of there about 11pm.  My son said that was the best service he had ever had.  That was a truly memorable meal for the last night of our Madrid holiday. Thank you Aldo and team from Michael, Jay, Claire and Junior.. "My wife and kids"

title_review: Fantastic place - a must visit in Madrid
review_preview: El miniBAR is a great place for various reasons. First of all it’s a typical tapas place so if you want to try it out there you have it. Secondly the quality of food there is really amazing so combined with a low price makes...
review_full: El miniBAR is a great place for various reasons. First of all it’s a typical tapas place so if you want to try it out there you have it.  Secondly the quality of food there is really amazing so combined with a low price makes it a stellar combination.  It’s conveniently located in the center so whether you are walking through Plaza Mayor or feel hungry after a whole day at Palacio Real - it’s right there for you.  The bar can be sometimes pretty full also with locals but that’s because it’s very good.  Finally it’s the only place I can think of where they actually tell you to order less because the portions will be big.... Absolutely fantastic experience - became my regular place to visit.  Thank you el miniBAR!

review_preview: During our visit to Madrid in 2016 we had drinks in a place called Del Diego Cocktail Bar, which was around the corner from our hotel.  This time around I searched for a new place (as Del Diego felt old fashioned and stuffy), and I...
review_full: During our visit to Madrid in 2016 we had drinks in a place called Del Diego Cocktail Bar, which was around the corner from our hotel. This time around I searched for a new place (as Del Diego felt old fashioned and stuffy), and I found Salmon Guru. I checked out the Google reviews and it looked like a place to try. My better looking half and I stopped by in the late afternoon and sat at the bar. Our bartender whipped us up a couple of boulevardiers, which were almost as good as mine ;-) I don't recall what my wife had for her second round, but I had the "pasión", which was very good. The bartender was friendly enough, but I have a feeling that if we were about 20-30 years younger he would've been friendlier. It has a young hipster vibe, and if we were there later in the evening we probably would've stood out. No matter, it's a nice place, but expect to drop a chunk of dough here, as the drinks are pricey.

title_review: Great and creative food at a great price and in a great location
review_preview: Burnout was a great place to get a great "Menu del Día" burger meal.  Our meals were fantastic and were part of a standard menu of choices available at this location.  The ambiance is more "American meets Paris" as great American music played in the...
review_full: Burnout was a great place to get a great "Menu del Día" burger meal. Our meals were fantastic and were part of a standard menu of choices available at this location. The ambiance is more "American meets Paris" as great American music played in the background while you sat close to your fellow customers; a combination that works well in this great European city. The burger's meat was 100% pure beef and cooked to perfection to ensure it was moist but not bloody; my wife's grilled chicken was cooked to perfection and not dried out. The accompanying salad and french fries were also appetizing. It isn't no wonder this place is so well rated. So go ahead and give it a try next time you are in Madrid shopping at the Gran Via.

title_review: The Best Burger I've ever had!
review_preview: Without a doubt, the best burger I've ever eaten, and we've had them from all over the world including the home of the burger - USA.The service was excellent and we enjoyed the whole atmosphere. It's a rather small place but if you get...
review_full: Without a doubt, the best burger I've ever eaten, and we've had them from all over the world including the home of the burger - USA. The service was excellent and we enjoyed the whole atmosphere. It's a rather small place but if you get there as soon as it's opened you should find seats as we did. We had the nachos and wings to share - both portions huge! For mains we all had burgers and I don't think I'll ever have another burger as good, or juicy as that again. It was genuinely fantastic and if you're in Madrid you'd be crazy to miss this place!! Thank you for a great evening with great food!

title_review: Best Burger and Service in Madrid
review_preview: We were here late afternoon New Year's eve after a long day walking around Madrid.  Our group was thirsty, hungry and grouchy, and it did not disappoint.  Great service from the start, did not wait more than 5 minutes for a table on a busy...
review_full: We were here late afternoon New Year's eve after a long day walking around Madrid. Our group was thirsty, hungry and grouchy, and it did not disappoint. Great service from the start, did not wait more than 5 minutes for a table on a busy day. Our server was on with drinks, wine, apps, food. The burgers were the best we've had (including US) and the family even had a shake for desert. Their Burnout sauce, bacon and buns and fries were first quality. Would recommend this to anyone traveling with kids, teenagers and young adults. Nice service is hard to find in Madrid, but not here. Absolutely a 10!!

I think it would be better if it's medium.

review_preview: Salmon Guru belongs to the new breed of cocktail bars in Madrid that are trying to sophisticate the drinking scene, earlier dominated by the “whatever alcohol, whatever mix” and headache next morning. Salmon Guru is a small bar located in centre where you can enjoy...
review_full: Salmon Guru belongs to the new breed of cocktail bars in Madrid that are trying to sophisticate the drinking scene, earlier dominated by the “whatever alcohol, whatever mix” and headache next morning. Salmon Guru is a small bar located in centre where you can enjoy some interesting decoration with superhero in the mirrors and neon lights. One of the interesting things about Salmon Guru is that they make sure everyone has a place to be seated and that might make you wait outside for a while if there are no spots. That guarantees that you will enjoy a cocktail with the right volume music and have a conversation without being pushed or interrumpted. Cocktails are really good and you have from the classics to the signature ones. Recommended.

When we left the restaurant at 22:00, there was quite a queue outside, so it is advisable to book.

Salmon Guru is split into 3 areas, the first around a very civilised bar, the second a darker space with black mirrors, coloured neon flashes across the ceiling, and comic exclamations on the walls. We sat at high tables in very comfortable arm chairs. The service was excellent, immediately being brought water and snacks, and good advice on the cocktail menu. The Orange Blossom and Negroni were both well presented and delicious. The music was great and as a package the bar was well worth the visit.

review_full: Found this little gem on a mini break with my Mum and wow...what a find. Firstly, love the quirky decor. Then, our server Richard was absolutely the best! So enthusiastic, helpful, funny and on-the-ball. It was super busy (and rightly so) but he flirted between the tables like a pro and made everyone feel so welcome and looked after. The cocktails are amazing!!! And the food. It was gorgeous. Superb quality, imaginative menu, quick service. I honestly loved it. I wish I lived in Madrid just so I can go back here! Repeatedly. One note- book in advance. This place is super popular and I think we were very lucky to get a table without a reservation. We had to wait 30 minutes and there’s a system in place for those that show up without a booking...but it’s dependent on those with a booking vacating their table. So avoid disappointment and reserve your spot in advance. Trust me, it’ll be worth it!

title_review: Certainly worth visiting. Very good food and service
review_preview: Visited the day of the home leg Athletico vs Juventus so the place was dominated by Italians, but nothwithstanding many tables of 6 or 8 our food came in good time and was great quality.We sat downstairs which is perhaps less appealing but this...
review_full: Visited the day of the home leg Athletico vs Juventus so the place was dominated by Italians, but nothwithstanding many tables of 6 or 8 our food came in good time and was great quality. We sat downstairs which is perhaps less appealing but this is not high end dining, its good everyday food. We started with Mozarella injected with pesto. Very tasty - but beware quite filling, then we had the pork fillet with blue cheese and apple sauce, and the ubiquitous Heuvos Rotos. The pork was the star - very tender and a surprising mix and balance of flavours. Most people that visit go for the paella which I am told is very nice (but also quite expensive). My advice is to take the advice of the staff - Alex did a great job of guiding us through, wish we had settled on all his recommendation as the two we had were great. Hes a nice guy too. Checkout the sister restaurant inClan if you have time - a previous trip for us, nice too, but this place gets my vote as the best.

title_review: Amazing food and drinks, friendly bartenders and a great atmosphere
review_preview: Stayed in an appartment right next door for a week, only went for a beer-before-bed the first few evenings, wish I'd tried the food earlier. Best fajitas I've eaten in Madrid, very tasty advocado sauce with some cheese, tomato and very tender mixed meats (chicken...
review_full: Stayed in an appartment right next door for a week, only went for a beer-before-bed the first few evenings, wish I'd tried the food earlier. Best fajitas I've eaten in Madrid, very tasty advocado sauce with some cheese, tomato and very tender mixed meats (chicken and beef, can of course pick either one). For drinks I'd highly recommend the cocktail called Cacao Passion, a home made recipe with the best Venezualan fruits that has it all; bit sour, bit sweet and some spice with it, you can taste all the flavors and it's even refreshing! And all that for a relatively low price. If you are ever in the neighbourhood, definitely try this restaurant-bar even if it's only for a single drink.

title_review: Good bar food, great arepas in particular
review_preview: Stopped here for brunch looking for something nice and filling, I was not disappointed. Relaxed atmosphere and delicious arepas, I'd recommend anything with plantain (can't go wrong there) and the arepa pabellon if you want all the best fillings at once. The guy who ran...
review_full: Stopped here for brunch looking for something nice and filling, I was not disappointed. Relaxed atmosphere and delicious arepas, I'd recommend anything with plantain (can't go wrong there) and the arepa pabellon if you want all the best fillings at once.  The guy who ran it was from Venuzuela himself and was very enthusiastic about the food, telling us about how his mother would always make arepas back home. He also spoke good enough English for me not to have to embarrass myself with my attempts at Spanish (he was nice enough to tell me my pronunciation was good though). There was a more restauranty section round the back, we weren't in there so I can't comment on that but as a bar that serves food I have no complaints.

title_review: A great first meal in Madrid
review_preview: We had dinner at Cacao Restobar on our first day in Madrid in June 2019.  Our experience there was wonderful in every way: excellent food and drink, friendly service, relaxing atmosphere, and reasonable prices.  We highly recommend Cacao Restobar for hungry, travel-weary tourists.We had...
review_full: We had dinner at Cacao Restobar on our first day in Madrid in June 2019. Our experience there was wonderful in every way: excellent food and drink, friendly service, relaxing atmosphere, and reasonable prices. We highly recommend Cacao Restobar for hungry, travel-weary tourists. We had a 20-minute wait for a table, which is not bad considering we arrived without a reservation on a Friday night. Next time, we’ll make a reservation; it’s easy enough to do online. The staff very nicely accommodated for our limited grasp of Spanish. For an appetizer, we shared an arepas sampler. It consisted of two full sized arepas rather than the four small ones in the description; no matter; they were delicious. An arepa is a corn bread round split and filled with a savory mixture of chicken, seafood, or other ingredients. The corn bread used is thicker than a tortilla, but not as cake-like as American “corn bread.” For entrees we had the sliced pork tenderloin with caramelized onions and goat cheese, the cuttlefish with roasted potatoes and salad, and the pabellon criolo (a traditional Venezuelan plate of pulled beef with rice, beans, plantains and a fried egg). The cuttlefish was described as “spicy,” but at our request they scaled back the heat to a mild level. The pork tenderloin was served over scalloped potatoes. The plantains with the pabellon criolo were savory rather than sweet, which combined very well with the other flavors on the plate. For beverages we shared a pitcher (jara) of sangria, and also a non-alcoholic pina colada and a non-alcoholic mango colada. All were quite sweet and served with a sprig of fresh spearmint (note there are plenty of non-sweet beverages available for those who prefer them). For dessert we shared a piece of the tres leches cake that others have recommended. It lived up to our high expectations; very sweet and almost custard-like in texture. Our server (manager? owner?) also brought us small servings of a creamy, coffee-flavored liquor “on the house.” A note about the background music, since it was mentioned by another reviewer: It does indeed consist of covers of Latin American pop standards; we could see the controlling computer monitor from our table, and the mix was clearly titled “Latino Acoustica.” Some songs are repeated in the mix, performed by different artists. It is understandable that the simple arrangements and repetition could be annoying to some; on the other hand, the setting is a restaurant, not a concert, and others might find it interesting to hear different artists’ acoustical takes on well-known tunes. Most important to us was the fact that the volume level was just right: loud enough to hear clearly if one wanted to listen, but not so loud as to hinder conversation. The restrooms are located up a short flight of stairs, and therefore not wheelchair accessible. The restaurant itself also had a few stairs at the main entrance. It is possible there is a second entrance without stairs, but we did not inquire about this.

The solomillo was melt in your mouth delicious accompanied buy a cheese sauce and a sweet apple (I think) sauce. The mixture together was an amazing flavor bomb. The huevos rotos had great flavor from the seasoning, and I loved how it was presented. The vibe inside is chill and welcoming. Great non-touristy find in Sol.

For me, this was my regular bar to stop by when I needed to do some work or send some e-mails, or just have a cold beer. The first thing the owner told me was «como to casa»! And the guys who run the place really are kind and affectionate and simply want you to have the best time while you're in town. Check it out, do it!  PS. Every bar in Madrid claim to have the best Sangria, Cacao Restobar really has it :)

review_preview: This restaurant is truly a gem! One of the best experiences we had in Madrid. The gentleman who was helping us (one of the owner’s at this family owned restaurant) was sweet, hospitable, and extremely attentive to us and our crazy toddler. He made recommendations...
review_full: This restaurant is truly a gem! One of the best experiences we had in Madrid. The gentleman who was helping us (one of the owner’s at this family owned restaurant) was sweet, hospitable, and extremely attentive to us and our crazy toddler. He made recommendations to us about the menu and helped us with our toddler who didn’t want to play with his toys anymore and was quickly losing interest in our distractions. The owner grabbed some cars that his six year old son had left and let our baby play with them. It was wonderful.  The food was also incredible and made our experience top notch. We each ordered different arepas. Mine was chicken and cheese and my husband ordered a shredded beef one with a fried egg, plantains, and black beans. Both delicious. The cappuccinos were also some of the best in Spain. I highly recommended coming here when you are in Madrid. You will not be disappointed.

title_review: Tasty food, and really good drinks!
review_preview: This place is small, with a friendly staff who knows their menu.  Definitely try this place any time of the day.Food: My wife and I came here twice, and in total ordered the patatas bravas, arepas, and croquettes.  All were very well seasoned, and...
review_full: This place is small, with a friendly staff who knows their menu. Definitely try this place any time of the day. Food: My wife and I came here twice, and in total ordered the patatas bravas, arepas, and croquettes. All were very well seasoned, and tasted great. Potatoes are covered in a sweet chili aioli, arepas are freshly made with a variety of options to fill it with. Chicken and beef were fantastic filling choices. Croquettes were as expected, but good. Drinks: Had beer and sangria. Sangria is a must if you enjoy good sangria. They make theirs fresh with brandy and fresh cinnamon, and it really shows in the flavor. Bartenders are A+. They know how to make all kinds of drinks, and are skilled at doing so. I asked for a carrajillo, and they delivered on point! Atmosphere: Small place with a few tables in the front and more in the back. Has a gastropub feel, except they will come to your table to take your order like a restaurant. It’s a bit dark inside, but it’s clean and the staff is welcoming. Pro Tip: Order the sangria and try the arepas. The owner is Venezuelan and his arepas reflect that style. Both the sangria and arepas are made with pride, and will be delicious.

title_review: Extra special tapas restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: My daughter and I recently visited Rosi La Loca as my daughter had heard great reports about it. We weren't disappointed - the tapas are quite unique and sophisticated but very tasty. We had one of their specials, peppers stuffed with cod with squid ink...
review_full: My daughter and I recently visited Rosi La Loca as my daughter had heard great reports about it. We weren't disappointed - the tapas are quite unique and sophisticated but very tasty. We had one of their specials, peppers stuffed with cod with squid ink and pesto - our helpful waitress Laura (blonde girl) had recommended it and it was a great choice. We also had a smoked octopus dish and a goats cheese salad both of which were delicious. The atmosphere and service were great and the decor is cool and relaxing. Tables are in big demand so it is worth making a reservation although you can also turn up without a booking and they will put you on a waiting list for later. We were pleasantly surprised by the bill - it is certainly not expensive for a restaurant of this calibre. We will definitely be back.

review_preview: Amazing One of my favourite meals ever! Really beautifully presented with an interesting choice of flavours and textures in the ‘short’ tasting menu which was excellent value for money. The wine menu was short but reasonably priced examples of good Spanish wines.I loved everything...
review_full: Amazing  One of my favourite meals ever! Really beautifully presented with an interesting choice of flavours and textures in the ‘short’ tasting menu which was excellent value for money. The wine menu was short but reasonably priced examples of good Spanish wines. I loved everything so I’ll simply pick some standouts !The double infusion that started this exciting culinary adventure was , at first blush, part of the table decoration: a glass vase with various dried mushrooms to which fresh herbs were added and then a bouillon that resulted in a rich umami broth. A one bite golden ball which burst in the mouth with flavours of the sea. A deconstructed Gazpacho with delicious ice cream and tomato drink was a revelation. Another stunning mushroom dish with the most delicate sabayon like sauce .My husband , not a great fan of duck was converted by the beautifully cooked duck and carrot dish, so tender. The desert, a sticky toffee pudding and brown butter ice cream,no doubt partly an nod to his years spent in England was a delight. Do yourself a favour and try out this wonderful restaurant - you’ll thank me for recommending it!

review_full: Enklima is a high caliber restaurant and it is a total joy dining there. The joy is about the flavors and the textures. No dish tastes random or bland, no dish has weird or conflicting textures. Everything is so precise, so full of flavors. And there is the ambience and service to match the food. The ambience is calm and relaxed. And I was really satisfied with the wine recommendations. It wasn’t necessarily wine I would buy myself, but they were interesting tastes and matched the food really well. And this to me is what Enklima is about - superior food that challenges your taste buds and what you imagined food could be like.

review_full: Stayed in Madrid for a long weekend and had the chance to visit a number of different cocktail bars with my partner to try the menus and enjoy the city. This was probably my favourite. The layout and decor was very cool and the mixology was creative and tasted fantastic.  The staff were really friendly and talkative (in English) due to my very limited Spanish. And made my visit a very enjoyable one. Prices were as you would pay across the city for cocktails. The venue is quite large and well designed therefore we were able to get a seat without a wait at 10pm on a Friday. I would love to visit again when I’m back in Madrid and would recommend this place to all who enjoy cocktails.

With 1 glass of sangria, 1 glass of wine and a bottle of water our bill was still about $36 in total. Delicious!

review_preview: My girlfriend and I went to Enklima on our last night in Madrid.  I made reservation 2 weeks in advance as I have read that it was a small restaurant and I wanted to go there while in Madrid based on the excellent reviews I...
review_full: My girlfriend and I went to Enklima on our last night in Madrid. I made reservation 2 weeks in advance as I have read that it was a small restaurant and I wanted to go there while in Madrid based on the excellent reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I have to say that we were not disappointed. First of all, Maria contacted me a week before to enquire about my girlfriend food’s allergies and I thought it was a very nice touch. The setting is very simple but the food is sublime! I was very impressed with their tasting menu and I thought they gave Cebo a run for their money since I went there a few days prior. The food is absolutely amazing, lots of flavors and great creativity. Their tasting menu consisted of a total of 11 dishes I believe that include 2 desserts. The only suggestion I would give them is to work on their wine pairing but everything else was amazing! I will not be surprised if they earn a Michelin Star one day. Thank you Maria for your great service and fantastic food! I could not have chosen a better restaurant to dine on my last night in Madrid. 100% recommended!!

title_review: Never had a meal like it!
review_preview: First impressions: the outside of this tiny restaurant is so discreet as to be almost non-descript, so you could easily walk past without realising it's there. But that would be a big mistake. Huge (to quote a certain person)The chef here is doing amazing,...
review_full: First impressions: the outside of this tiny restaurant is so discreet as to be almost non-descript, so you could easily walk past without realising it's there. But that would be a big mistake. Huge (to quote a certain person) The chef here is doing amazing, bizarre, but incredible things with flavours and textures.  After a warm greeting from one of the waitstaff, you sit down, and notice what looks like a weird autumnal floral decoration, in a jug, on your table.  But that turns out of be one of your starters! A "double infusion" of mushrooms, garlic, lemongrass and a whole host of other ingredients (each dish was explained as it was presented, but without either recording it, or asking them to repeat it several times, there is no way I would remember everything), served as a wonderful consommé, the rich flavours of which set the scene for the rest of the evening! I could probably write a review of each course, but given there were 4 starters, bread, fish, 2 meat courses and 2 desserts, I'd be here all night Standouts (although it's like trying to pick your favourite children!) were the Cod, the Duck, the "Lamb Sandwich" and the Mushroom dish with Meringue pieces (not joking) After the Sticky Toffee Pudding with Salted Caramel Ice-cream and curry powder (still not joking), the waitress brought out 2 leaves on a plate, explaining that they were to cleanse the palate before the last course, and that we should not think so much about the flavour as the feeling (?) So, to the wife's comment of "It looks like privet" we chewed away, only to experience the plant equivalent of Space Dust, leaving our mouths tingling - we just burst out laughing at the sheer playfulness of it. All of this is done for €48 for the short menu or €63 for the long - about a quarter of the price you'd pay at somewhere like DiverXO (and without the 6 month waiting list) I can't believe that this place isn't higher up the rankings, or that we were lucky enough to find it, after some random trawling of TA. Do yourself a favour and try it next time you're in Madrid - you won't be disappointed

title_review: Amazing every time I have been there
review_preview: Alcaravea is fantastic! I have been there a number of times and it is a delicious place to try spanish food with a twist! I always take there my foreign friends to enjoy a yummy, well balanced and variety meal! Every time I have been...
review_full: Alcaravea is fantastic! I have been there a number of times and it is a delicious place to try spanish food with a twist!  I always take there my foreign friends to enjoy a yummy, well balanced and variety meal!  Every time I have been there, food has been outstanding! Good service, consistent quality makes it a place to go back I would recommend the zucchini flowers with cheese, croquetas, squid and all type of fish, huevos rotos con gambones...  Ask the waiter the plate du jour, they always have heaps of specials!  Sizes are quite big so ask as well wether you just need half a dish!  It gets pretty crowded, even though they have 2 services - call to make a reservation. I would fully recommend it for anyone that wants to have a true spanish food experience!  Full of locals and a great place to top the dinner with a nice drink! They have a great selection of spirirts!

title_review: Rush there before he gets a star
review_preview: We were fortunate to book a table for the Saturday night: Real Madrid played Juventus that night and everyone else seemed to be glued to their television. There was just us in the restaurant and a French couple.The food is truly outstanding! From the...
review_full: We were fortunate to book a table for the Saturday night: Real Madrid played Juventus that night and everyone else seemed to be glued to their television. There was just us in the restaurant and a French couple. The food is truly outstanding! From the first bite to the last, a pure pleasure, intense, balanced flavours from a young but extremely promising chef. The price-quality ratio is unbeatable, 44 euros for a small sampling menu of nine courses, starting with a "doble infusion" with strong mushroom overtones, to a black squid chip and a small beef tapa, and then on to a second squid course, a flavourful mushroom with crushed meringue, cod fish, pigeon and the final sweet touch of lemon-infused ice cream with green pepper. I wish I lived in Madrid, so we could come again.

review_full: Great, authentic local restaurant. We had this recommended by our hotel which was just along the street - and we are glad we did ! The Iberico ham on tomato bread is a fantastic starter, we also tried the prawns and aoli which were sweet and tender. You must try the steak cooked on your own hot stone - it is so tender and so flavorsome! we washed this down with some excellent Rioja. To end, we had the Galician specialty Queimada - you must try it ! The final surprise was the cost - very reasonable (30 Euros a head) and worth a lot more !

review_full: I like this place. They serve Spanish style burguers with high quality meat which are delicious. Bad side is that the restaurant is very small, so it is difficult to get a table, specially on weekends. My favourite burguer is Cibeles, with a special cheese and beer flavour. Chicken wings and sausages are also very recommended.

title_review: Cozy neighborhood Spanish craft beer place with great food

review_full: I am a big craft beer fan, so when I found out I was going to be in Madrid, I looked for some craft beer bars in the neighborhood of our hotel.  I found the Fogg Bar and I am so glad I did. They have a great variety of Spanish craft beers and a very cozy setting. The first night my wife and I just stopped in for a couple of beers, but then we returned with a friend and had some more phenomenal beers and I ordered probably one of the best burgers I have had in a long time. The people working there are extremely helpful and very nice. If you are into craft beer and great food, stop by.

title_review: A brilliant eating experience, fantastic service
review_preview: Yeterday I was looking for a nice place to dine and enjoy my last nigth in Madrid. I surfed the internet and I was positively impressed by the comments about this restaurant made by other travellers.I felt welcomed from the first moment I stepped...
review_full: Yeterday I was looking for a nice place to dine and enjoy my last nigth in Madrid. I surfed the internet and I was positively impressed by the comments about this restaurant made by other travellers. I felt welcomed from the first moment I stepped into the door, the place was packed altough the noice level was more than acceptable, allowing people to have conversation without having to shout, thanks to the phono-absorbent panels I guess. I was lucky enought to get a table, the place looks nice, the look is modern and rich, without exageration, everything seems to be just right. The waiter arrived and informed me that he would have gone for reduced portions as I was eating by myself and their normal portions are very abundant, which sounded to me like good news and a right start. The starter arrived after a few minutes, croguettes flowers, covered in a delicious Spanish wine sauce, and filled with a tasty and creamy local cheese. I was surprised by how good it tasted it, even the best review could not really make me realize the level of cooking that this restaurant is able to deliver.  The main course was even better, and it was a lot of tender meat, guarnished with vegetables and potatoes, melting in my mouth. After the coffee, I was prepared to pay what I thought the meal worthed, I was expecting to see an expensive check, but at that point, I was sooooo happy with the experience I had, I could not think about anything else. When I saw that the total was €28, for starter, main course, 2 cervezas and coffee, I was super astonished, happily surprised, especially considering the impeccable quality and freshness of the ingredients. If you go to Madrid, missing this opportunity would be a big mistake!

We came back the next night. Not a lot of choice in the vicinity of our hotel but this was a perfectly fine authentic Spanish restaurant experience.

review_preview: We enjoyed our meal here so much we are booked to go back tonight. A friendly & attentive owner/manager supported by young, friendly & knowledgeable staff. It was the first restaurant I have been to where the staff recommend half portions, but they were right...
review_full: We enjoyed our meal here so much we are booked to go back tonight. A friendly & attentive owner/manager supported by young, friendly & knowledgeable staff. It was the first restaurant I have been to where the staff recommend half portions, but they were right the half portions were still generous & really delicious. I took one contributor's recommendation & had the eggs with the chorizo meat - really simple but delicious. We also enjoyed the medallions of pork loin with caramelised onions & Brie. We even shared the dessert - unlike many places it was big enough to share. We ordered wine by the glass, which was topped up but we were only charged for one glass each. They certainly know how to treat customers & were obviously very popular with locals of all ages. I was glad we had booked as it was full, both upstairs & down. The bill was a surprise as it was really reasonable for such quality. Because we had half portions we only paid 33 euros in all - the portion prices were reduced but just a little over half the full price, so excellent value. We are now looking forward to tonight's meal & to trying something completely different, but I'm sure equally delicious.

review_preview: I had a one night layover in Madrid and went to Alcaravea Gaztambide because of all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. My entire experience was fantastic...even better than I expected.I got there a little early (around 7:45), but Imad, Alcaravea Gaztambide's bartender, was...
review_full: I had a one night layover in Madrid and went to Alcaravea Gaztambide because of all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. My entire experience was fantastic...even better than I expected. I got there a little early (around 7:45), but Imad, Alcaravea Gaztambide's bartender, was very friendly. He poured me a glass of wine while I waited for the restaurant to open at 8:00. Once it opened I just asked for Imad's recommendations for everything and had some of the best food and wine I've ever had. I know a lot of people have already mentioned the octopus below...but it was out of this world. Get it.  The food and wine portions were very generous and the bill was surprisingly small. The staff was extremely friendly ( they didn't even mind that I speak almost no Spanish). It was a great experience and made my one night in Madrid extremely memorable. In October my fiance and I plan to spend some of our honeymoon in Madrid and we will definitely be going to Alcaravea Gaztambide (multiple times if I am deciding).

review_preview: Ok. So my wife and I showed up a bit early, having arrived during the day after a long flight. I guess it was about 6:30 pm, on our way to flamenco. Since we were the first customers, and bartender was friendly, we decided to...
review_full: Ok. So my wife and I showed up a bit early, having arrived during the day after a long flight. I guess it was about 6:30 pm, on our way to flamenco. Since we were the first customers, and bartender was friendly, we decided to sit down and have a glass of wine. If God had decided to open up a tapas restaurant, he would have chosen Alcaravea Gaztambide. After taking pity on us, they opened up the kitchen a bit early. My wife and I told the bartender that we would leave the ordering to him--which I recommend usually when I'm traveling. We had a beatiful, fresh salad, and the most amazing octopus in a saffron infused sauce...it really took a lot for my wife to eat octopus, after a rather troubling experience in Turkey, but alas, it was devine. While the bartender entertained us and gave us some great recommendations for Madris, we hungrily downed a beef tapas, while watching Charlie Chaplin movies. Have I discussed the Chaplin movies? whatever you do when you goto Alcaravea, don't mention the Chaplin movies, apparently their is a bit of controversy between the owner and the staff regarding the entertainment value of the Chaplin movies. No, in all seriousness, it felt like the bar that you walk into from a movie set, and you don't want to leave. We walked out stuff, energiized, and ready for flamenco. If you goto Madrid, pity not to stop by....they will treat you like a long lost friend. Just no Chaplin

title_review: The BEST restaurant in Madrid. Simply phenomenal
review_preview: I speak for both Alcaravea and the sister restaurant Alcaravea Gaztambide in this review, having visited both on numerous occasions during my 6 months in Madrid. I only have great things to say about this place... not ONE negative comment to makeI stumbled upon...
review_full: I speak for both Alcaravea and the sister restaurant Alcaravea Gaztambide in this review, having visited both on numerous occasions during my 6 months in Madrid. I only have great things to say about this place... not ONE negative comment to make I stumbled upon this restaurant thanks to TripAdvisor as it happens. At the time it was in the top three places to eat in Madrid - it still should be! - and as I lived in the center it wasn't difficult to get to.  While the first time we went was on a weekday early evening, so we were able to walk right in, friday to sunday dinners I would suggest booking in advance. Even during subsequent visits, when there were only two of us and we hadn't booked, the warm and welcoming staff were happy to make space even if it meant shifting a few tables.  The first thing I noticed about this place when walking in was the mouthwatering aroma of beautifully cooked Spanish food lingering in the air. In both restaurants the owner would personally seat us, keep conversation flowing throughout the dining experience and always be available for advice and recommendations. The staff all spoke perfect English, and even the owner of the Gaztambide branch who wasn't quite as fluent, would make jokes in Spanglish and recognize me everytime I came back.  Not only is this place perfectly romantic for couples, I went twice with family (just 2-3 of us) and another few times with a massive group of friends, which didn't make the service and food any less personable and punctual. I insisted some of my Spanish friends should book it for their birthdays, and they all raved about it and congratulated me on the fantastic find, all wishing that they had discovered the place years ago in their own hometown. Even my foodie friend whose parents own a restaurant took her family here and they were just bowled over. Which seems to be the general reaction. As for the food, be it recommendations from the staff, or the complimentary 'amuse-bouche' that came with every meal (from many types of warm fresh bread and cheeses, to tangy shots of gazpacho) or the array of amazing desserts (and I learnt that Spain weren't the best at cakes and desserts, perhaps it's their flour.... but this place changed that perception in seconds) It was all absolutely breathtaking. If I didnt have favourites that I would continually choose, I would have loved to get through the entire menu. ahhh the favourites (see pictures)... MUST ORDER:  -Kilo of Kobe Beef Now i'm not a steak/beef/burger fan whatsoever. It's always been too chewy for me, or lacking flavour. So when (only thanks to a recommendation by the staff) we ordered a kilo of Kobe beef, rare and still moo-ing on the plate (at a ridiculously cheap price of £30) which came with potatoes and green peppers, i was a little apprehensive. It was the most succulent, melt-in-the-mouth, delicious meat I had ever tasted. And the portion was so huge, but too delectable to waste. This dish alone is a reason for anyone to come here. -Croquettas (especially the goats cheese and honey) Delicate, perfectly crispy on the outside and silky smooth on the inside. Possibly the best croquettas I've tasted... and I've had a fair few in my day -Calamari Commonly overcooked, chewy and bland. Not this time! Perfection -Desserts Because you couldn't possibly choose as everyone of the desserts are heavenly. But the Tiramisu inside a toblerone is a stroke of genius!!! Even though we were bursting at the seams from all the food, we HAD to have some of this. We ended up waddling home, our bellies pregnant with the tastiest meal I'd eaten in a very long time. But the real icing on the cake was the bill at the end. For such attentive, creative fine-dining the price was extremely reasonable, making Alcaravea free from that 'fine-dining' pretentious nature.  Honest, humble food made with heart and passion. No wonder Spain has been a contender for the best restaurants in the world this past decade. I implore you.... don't miss out.

review_full: Having read a few tripadvisor reviews, we decided that Alcaravea was well worth a visit. Its a little of the beaten track but don't let that put you off at all. We went by car and there is public car park a stones throw from the restaurant. We didn't make a reservation, but even on a wet Monday night it was quite busy later on. The menu is superb. It covers so many Spanish dishes and puts a twist on others. The waiter was absolutely first class. He made suggestions on what we were interested in trying and advised that the mains course could be made smaller into starters so as we could try more dishes. The dishes were all very tasty and well cooked. You can certainly pay a lot more for a lot less in Madrid. We will be returning and taking family when they visit in the future. Highly recommended.

As much as I love Spanish wine I would make a detour in Madrid to come here.

title_review: Fresh & new interpretation of Peruvian cuisine DELICIOUS
review_preview: What a discovery! Walking down Don Ramon de la Cruz I found this Peruvian restaurant with new interpretations of some traditional dishes such as ceviche and tiraditos. Delicious!!! I love Peruvian food and have tried quite a few restaurants even Astrid & Gastón in Lima....
review_full: What a discovery! Walking down Don Ramon de la Cruz I found this Peruvian restaurant with new interpretations of some traditional dishes such as ceviche and tiraditos. Delicious!!! I love Peruvian food and have tried quite a few restaurants even Astrid & Gastón in Lima. Cilindro is definitely worth it. It attracts a young, stylish crowd and offers some 20 options roughly between starters and main courses, while some 5 dessert options. The wine card is smaller. Price-wise Peruvian cuisine is not cheap because of all the fresh ingredients particularly fish but they also offer raciones and half raciones. Service was friendly and quick.

review_preview: We went here tonight and it was instantly a highlight of our trip. The restaurant is down a side street (which you need to find) but once there you can't miss it. Lovely, unique decor! Richard was our server, speaking perfect English as well as...
review_full: We went here tonight and it was instantly a highlight of our trip. The restaurant is down a side street (which you need to find) but once there you can't miss it. Lovely, unique decor! Richard was our server, speaking perfect English as well as his native Spanish, and was always very prompt and attentive. He tended to all the guests in such a manner, which was quite an achievement as it was very busy! And the food that got served was amazing. We ordered the burrata (injected with pesto!), Croquetas, octopus with celeriac, and the surf and turf paella. They were all outstanding, and got served in good intervals, so not all at once. If you want authentic Spanish cuisine with a twist, this is the place for you. Fully recommend!

title_review: Fantastic last meal in Madrid and we'll be back!
review_preview: For our last meal in Madrid, my girlfriend and I were actually looking for a restaurant that serves paella but we stumbled across this gem of a restaurant instead.  The restaurant is clean and very well decorated so that ambience was very good from 1st...
review_full: For our last meal in Madrid, my girlfriend and I were actually looking for a restaurant that serves paella but we stumbled across this gem of a restaurant instead. The restaurant is clean and very well decorated so that ambience was very good from 1st impression. The bartender/owner was very friendly and made a wonderful mojito Cacao for me. The highlight, though, was the meal itself. We ordered an appetizer of patacones that came with on the side bbq meat, pico, and guacamole. Then for the main entree my girlfriend and I ordered the Pulpo a la plancha and prawns risotto. Both were delicious! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

title_review: Amazing service, great food, awesome experience
review_preview: We spent the last dinner of our honeymoon at this restaurant. Coming from a background in fine dining and hotel management we were astonished by the service. When we arrived the restaurant was almost empty, we had no reservation but that was not an issue,...
review_full: We spent the last dinner of our honeymoon at this restaurant. Coming from a background in fine dining and hotel management we were astonished by the service.  When we arrived the restaurant was almost empty, we had no reservation but that was not an issue, in about 20 minutes all the tables were occupied.  When we arrived and asked for the drink menu, the response was simply: "what would you like to drink?" - We ended up having the best bloody mary we've ever had.  The staff (the brothers who run the establishment) were extremely friendly, and gave us great recommendations for food.  We had the pequeños and grilled scampi for starters, both prepared well.  The fajitas (mix of chicken and beef) and shrimp risotto were also fantastic.  Unfortunately we were too full for desert, nevertheless they looked great.  Athmosphere is nice, minimal design. The staff's spirited attitude to great service is not questionable. Definitely a must go to place when in Madrid.

review_full: Glass is a must try for seafood lovers. The plankton sauce was very intense but something you don’t usually experience with ordinary seafood dishes. The sausages were all made with different kind of fish and have a meat like texture. The vermouth melon is highly recommended but the alcoholic flavour was not as strong as anticipated. The Citrus was surprisingly refreshing and it was great to clean the pallet after a heavy meal. Service was attentive but never over bearing. Overall a great experience!

title_review: Food was great. Staff was lovely but a bit forgetful.
review_preview: We would definitely recommend going to this restaurant for some lovely South American tapas. The food was lovely and fresh and the gentleman serving us was super friendly. The only problem was that he didn't write anything down.  The gentleman was very happy to talk...
review_full: We would definitely recommend going to this restaurant for some lovely South American tapas. The food was lovely and fresh and the gentleman serving us was super friendly. The only problem was that he didn't write anything down. The gentleman was very happy to talk with me about which dishes we could adapt to make them vegan... But then the nachos came out with cheese on. The waiter was more than happy to take them back and get me a fresh plate without cheese. Then my main didn't come out at all (vegetable strudel). We thought it was because the atmosphere was very relaxed and food came out as it was prepared but by the time my husband and friend had finished their main, we didn't bother to mention it to the waiter nor did we get billed for the item. These are very two minor problems but I didn't think it was fair to give them a perfect score.

review_preview: Planned a visit to Madrid from London with my wife and checked out best restaurants on tripadvisor. Found the place and gave them a ring on the day and they said they were busy, but they will manage to squeeze us in.   We got there...
review_full: Planned a visit to Madrid from London with my wife and checked out best restaurants on tripadvisor. Found the place and gave them a ring on the day and they said they were busy, but they will manage to squeeze us in.  We got there and been told to wait 10-15 mins so they can sort something out for us. The place was packed. After 10 mins we were seated to a small 2 pers table, but asked before if that is ok with us.  They were opened to a chat in english, but i tried to do it in spanish and i was complimented for it.  Starters come out. Really good. Nothing mind blowing but really good. And then mains. Wow. Had the grilled octopus. Best ever.  Prices are very good but the most important thing is these guys attention to customers. You are number 1 in their eyes, as it should be. They make everybody feel welcome and homely.  All in all i take great pleasure in reviewing this place and giving it top marks.  Well done guys !!! Keep it up!!!

review_preview: We had planned to go here on our honeymoon because of the rave reviews on Trip Adviser, but they still aren't enough to speak to the wonders of this place!! The staff were incredible, working through our meager Spanish and making the whole experience fun....
review_full: We had planned to go here on our honeymoon because of the rave reviews on Trip Adviser, but they still aren't enough to speak to the wonders of this place!! The staff were incredible, working through our meager Spanish and making the whole experience fun. The food was out of this world -- we had the nachos, bravas, plantains, and Spanish cheese sticks from the tapas menu. All were fantastic. Then the sangria. The white sangria was the best I've ever had and very seasonal with cinnamon. The manager of the restaurant chatted with us a few times and offered us their homemade liqueur with our check. Also an amazing concoction.  Do not miss Cacao Restobar when you go to Madrid.

review_preview: Booked a table for 3 tonight, using a Madrid gastronomy voucher I had received as a gift. The place looked closed (people inside, but the lights were out). Turned out to be a problem with electricity cables in the street outside. The problem was resolved...
review_full: Booked a table for 3 tonight, using a Madrid gastronomy voucher I had received as a gift. The place looked closed (people inside, but the lights were out). Turned out to be a problem with electricity cables in the street outside. The problem was resolved quickly and I'm glad it was. We had a lovely meal - a perfect casual dining experience, ie tasty food at reasonable prices with friendly and helpful staff. The patacones were delicious. The tres leches cake too. We had a bottle of wine to go with it. The portions didn't look big, but they are well measured - you won't be hungry, but not so big as to be off putting. Overall a very pleasant evening - muchas gracias to all the staff!

review_preview: We were eating early by Madrid standards due to an early flight the next morning and sat in the bar area. Great ambiance with a fun, inviting interior. Excellent service, too.  Some dishes were a hit, others not so much. I highly recommend the Patacones...
review_full: We were eating early by Madrid standards due to an early flight the next morning and sat in the bar area. Great ambiance with a fun, inviting interior. Excellent service, too. Some dishes were a hit, others not so much. I highly recommend the Patacones -- flat fried plantains with toppings of avocado cream, pulled pork, and pico de gallo. The arepas were also very good -- basically muffin-sized cornbread circle sandwiches with a variety of fillings. The sauteed mushrooms and garlic were a bit boring and the pulpo a la gallega had been cooked a smidge too long, and I felt was also a bit bland. The octopus sits on a slice of potato with very little seasoning. Although our dishes were not all hits, I do recommend this restaurant. The dishes we liked were truly delicious.

title_review: Super little find with fabulous service!
review_preview: Just lovely to find a place where the staff really care about your visit. This is a fun, relaxed place, the welcome is genuinely warm and the food is wholesome and hearty. The house Mojito is pretty fantastic too! Our starters were delicious, garlic prawns...
review_full: Just lovely to find a place where the staff really care about your visit. This is a fun, relaxed place, the welcome is genuinely warm and the food is wholesome and hearty. The house Mojito is pretty fantastic too! Our starters were delicious, garlic prawns and fried cheese sticks with a yummy dip. My husband had the fajitas which he said were tasty and I had the prawn risotto which was a little bit light on taste but when the waiter noticed I hadn't eaten it all he said I was only going to pay half because I'd only eaten half - a lovely touch but I felt so bad, he really cared. We had room for dessert - thank goodness, they were amazing, passion fruit pie and a cheesecake - both superb! All in all this is a lively, casual place with good food. What makes it a great place is the staff who without exception are fantastic. Wouldn't hesitate to return.

Dishes are served quite fast, we were informed of dishes that will take longer to be made.  My favourite dishes are the croquette ala Rosi La Loca, buratta with pesto, squid tentacles with celeriac puree and the chocolate crust with violet ice-cream.  Bread is bottomless.  Would visit again!

review_preview: Delicious food, attentive service, and colorful atmosphere. Our main server, Andres, was polite, attentive, helpful, and spoke perfect English. We didn’t catch the names of the other staff who were also very helpful, and working very hard to provide excellent service. The smoked octopus was...
review_full: Delicious food, attentive service, and colorful atmosphere. Our main server, Andres, was polite, attentive, helpful, and spoke perfect English. We didn’t catch the names of the other staff who were also very helpful, and working very hard to provide excellent service. The smoked octopus was delicious and entertainingly served with a smoky flair. The eggplant fritters were interesting, and the ham croquettes were delicious. Our servers apologized about our paella taking long to arrive, though we really didn’t notice. The staff made multiple efforts to make up for our paella wait time. However, from our seat near the kitchen, we saw how efficiently everyone was working and did not feel at all inconvenienced as we enjoyed our tapas and wine, entertained by the whirlwind in the kitchen. It’s Spain. If the food is taking long, enjoy the atmosphere and drink more wine. We’ve had long waits for paella not worth our time and this was NOT the case here. Their seafood paella is among one of the better ones we’ve had in Spain. House wine was nice, the sangria was tasty though a bit sweet for our taste. Good value and an interesting restaurant worth checking out.

title_review: Best Asian in Madrid so far
review_preview: Madrid is fantastic and it has its fair share of good Asian restaurants, but very seldom do they dare to go all the way. We wanted clear tastes, hot food, fresh ingredients and something different. And this was certainly the place. The food was tasty,...
review_full: Madrid is fantastic and it has its fair share of good Asian restaurants, but very seldom do they dare to go all the way. We wanted clear tastes, hot food, fresh ingredients and something different. And this was certainly the place. The food was tasty, spicy, delicate, and wonderful. The Massamam curry brought us to heaven. The biggest problem with this place is that one would tend to eat too much! :-) So far, this is the best Asian we've been at in Madrid. Don't worry about the "strange" location, but do book, just in case. It would be a shame to miss. (I know, to name a "best Asian" is stupid. However, in this case it applies.)

review_preview: Myself and my boyfriend went here enticed by the vibrant colours and photos of the food on the online menu. However when we ordered two “super tapas” dishes - a spicy aioli potato dish and the tacos, we were presented with a minuscule bowl containing...
review_full: Myself and my boyfriend went here enticed by the vibrant colours and photos of the food on the online menu. However when we ordered two “super tapas” dishes - a spicy aioli potato dish and the tacos, we were presented with a minuscule bowl containing all of one single potato chopped up into squares. The two tacos were equally tiny, each one smaller than the size of a hand. After seeing the same dish served to the spanish people next to us which was easily double the size, we complained about our bill, to which the waitress immediately and without question amended our bill for the potatoes to the price for the smaller size (not at all for the tacos, despite them being nothing like the picture). Her being totally unsurprised just approved our suspicions that they regularly attempt to scam young tourists like ourselves. If you go here, be sure to check your bill twice or three times and have a good look at what they serve to the Spanish customers compared to yourselves. Not at all recommended for anyone with an appetite or a conscience.

title_review: Pepe Made Our Dining Experience a Delight
review_preview: My partner and I had a one-night layover in Madrid and wanted to try a local restaurant. We ventured into Restaurante Campanillas and were immediately greeted by Pepe, a welcoming man who clearly tries to please every patron. After explaining the menu to us, we...
review_full: My partner and I had a one-night layover in Madrid and wanted to try a local restaurant. We ventured into Restaurante Campanillas and were immediately greeted by Pepe, a welcoming man who clearly tries to please every patron. After explaining the menu to us, we ordered several delicious items that he recommended, such as meatballs, omelettes, prosciutto and cheese on toast, fresh peppers, etc. For dessert, we had chocolate ice cream balls and flan, which was the best I’ve ever had. The entire bill (including two glasses of wine) came to $42. Very reasonable by NY standards. We would highly recommend Restaurante Campanillas!

review_preview: We love local food served in small family restaurants. But we didn't love this. Ultimately we left quite disappointed. (In fairness, we might not have been disappointed had the reviews on Tripadvisors not ranked this so highly. Mind you, we wouldn't have gone at all....
review_full: We love local food served in small family restaurants. But we didn't love this. Ultimately we left quite disappointed. (In fairness, we might not have been disappointed had the reviews on Tripadvisors not ranked this so highly. Mind you, we wouldn't have gone at all. I'm shocked at the Tripadvisor ranking!) We were charged 40 Euro for not much: two coffees, three hot chocolates and five bland sandwiches (small white buns with a bit of ham and crushed tomatoes). The hot chocolate was actually a cup of milk with a packet of nearly flavourless powder to mix in ourselves. The tomatoes tasted and looked tinned. Certainly not fresh local produce. A friendly owner/employee chattered away and handed over cheap trinkets that we would never want to purchase (repeatedly saying "my treat"). We were shocked at the bill (we never received a menu and just acceited the recommended meal, and so we didn't know what the price would be) But we smiled and paid and handed over the usual European tip: the small change. The employee/owner took the tray with the change and with a big smile asked "tip?". But when he saw the small change he was suddenly not so friendly anymore. The smile vanished and he walked away without a word. (Perhaps more generous tips are oftentimes given - and have come to be expected- from non-Europeans.) There were regulars stopping in for coffee so obviously the locals are happy here (we didn't see anyone else dining). There is a large terrace with a shrub surround and a lot of umbrellas, but the street has through traffic.

title_review: I went there with some friends
review_preview: I went there with some friends and unfortunately two of them said the next day they had vomited their dinner. I am not surprised since some of the things we ordered were very far from what I would call authentic Mexican food, unfortunately. I asked...
review_full: I went there with some friends and unfortunately two of them said the next day they had vomited their dinner. I am not surprised since some of the things we ordered were very far from what I would call authentic Mexican food, unfortunately. I asked for enchiladas verdes and was given some tortillas swimming in a sort of cheese or bechamel sauce. A friend of ours ordered some Cochinita pibil tacos and he ate half of one and gave the rest away. I tried one and it wasn’t what it should have been. Pork covered in lard is not cochinita pibil. And I don’t write lard to be funny, the meat was soaked in grease.  The service was nice, or not, depending on the waiter waiting on you. The Spanish waiter was very friendly and nice, whereas his Mexican colleague I guess was having a bad day. Lastly, we waited around 40 minutes between our first course (basically ceviche and guacamole for three) and the main course. When we asked the waiter about our food he left and came back saying it would be coming up shortly, but we still had to wait for it to arrive about 5 more minutes. I don’t think understand why a restaurant of all places would think its ok to leave such a long gap in between courses. As a parting thought, the place really needs to revamp the toilets. The massive spiderweb wasn’t very nice to look, among other things. I wont be going there again or recommended this place to any of my friends. I was very disappointed at the whole experience, to say nothing of my friends vomiting their dinner.

review_preview: This was our final dinner after 10 days in Spain and we agreed we wanted one last paella dish.  To start, the owner/chef was so nice and personable. Then we realized we hit the jackpot here!  The paella was fresh, made to order and delicious!...
review_full: This was our final dinner after 10 days in Spain and we agreed we wanted one last paella dish. To start, the owner/chef was so nice and personable. Then we realized we hit the jackpot here! The paella was fresh, made to order and delicious! Great way to leave this beautiful country ... with very happy and satisfied bellies! We started with a cheese and ham plate which was great, but the paella was our favorite! We ordered 2 seafood paellas, 1 chicken paella and 1 vegetable paella. All of them were delicious. And we tried several paella meals during our stay so we're practically food critics at this point! Seriously, worth a visit to this restaurant. You'll be happy you avoided a tourist trap with decent food food and inflated prices but instead had an amazing home cooked meal at a very reasonable price!

review_preview: This restaurant is definitely not one of those big touristy places.  But WOW is it good!  We went here for our last night in Spain dinner as we were looking for a good paella dish to send us home with happy bellies.  And we found...
review_full: This restaurant is definitely not one of those big touristy places. But WOW is it good! We went here for our last night in Spain dinner as we were looking for a good paella dish to send us home with happy bellies. And we found the right place! The owner/chef clearly makes everything fresh, while you’re there. We started with a cheese plate and some bread because we couldn’t wait the 20 to 30 minutes until the Paella was ready. Hot, just baked bread and some cheese and ham. Hit the spot. And then the highlight ... freshly made, right out of the oven paella. 2 orders of seafood, 1 chicken and 1 vegetarian paella. 4 very happy diners! We did have 1 non-paella eater with us and he said his pasta dish was delicious. I think it’s a cereal bar type of restaurant for breakfast, but don’t be turned off by that. This guy makes seriously good, very fresh, yummy paella. We would all go back in a heartbeat!

review_preview: You head to a new city and check TripAdvisor for a place to eat. There are ads. There are tourist traps that are 150% marked up, but our friends from Scandinavia and London don’t realize because Spain is so reasonable. There are places that have...
review_full: You head to a new city and check TripAdvisor for a place to eat. There are ads. There are tourist traps that are 150% marked up, but our friends from Scandinavia and London don’t realize because Spain is so reasonable. There are places that have paella, and are rated highly even though they have meh paella because the other tourists haven’t figured out that all paella is good, but they’re not having anything special.  Then there’s Real Talent Cafe. Off in a side street away from the major tourist hubs, this place has it all. Unbelievable, authentic paella made on the spot (~30 minutes to cook, so you know it’s real); homemade bread and pasta; excellent service; and reasonable prices. My goodness! I’m so happy we stumbled into this gold mine, which was our best meal in a week in Spain.  Could not recommend more highly!

review_preview: This is a hidden gem of a restaurant. We entered a few minutes and were greeted with a big smile and hello from Reyni who asked if we would like a glass of wine before dinner. She made suggestions and allowed us to taste a...
review_full: This is a hidden gem of a restaurant. We entered a few minutes and were greeted with a big smile and hello from Reyni who asked if we would like a glass of wine before dinner. She made suggestions and allowed us to taste a few reds and whites. We were able to comfortably enjoy a glass of wine before our dinner and had a nice talk with Reyni who told us about the various wines that you can purchase. We settled on a very nice bottle of Tempranillo. Our dinner started off with the best breads we have had on our trip in either Portugal or Spain. The Olive oil enhances all of the bread selections. For starters we had the pate and foie and Beluga lentils. My wife had the Tourbot and I had the Iberian Ham cheeks. For dessert we had the Chocolate Toutin with ice cream and finished with a lovely dessert wine. The service and food was excellent we give the entire experience 5 Stars only because we can only give 5. This is a 10 star restaurant. They do not rush you so plan on spending time here. Thank you Lourdes your an amazing chef, thank you Carlos for your help and thank you Reyni you are the best host! We cannot wait for our next trip back.

Located in the wonderful Barrio de Salamanca district, Las Caboneras de Lu is located off a very quiet side street. The main entrance brings you into the wine store where you can enjoy a pre-dinner drink before descending into the breathtakingly cozy underground dining room.  The cuisine is traditional Spanish with a modern twist. No matter if you order fish. meat or poultry, you will not be disappointed. The desserts are not to be missed.

The seafood fideua was very salty and spread very thinly on the pan so was over cooked to the point of being crispy and like a pancake. Looks a nice setting but would go elsewhere as not worth the money.

review_preview: What an absolute treat...what a great meal...what a great evening!  Even from the street the upstairs wine shop is elegant and tasteful.  Although we had a feeling Las Carboneras de Lu might be very very nice, we and our friends were in for a stunning...
review_full: What an absolute treat...what a great meal...what a great evening! Even from the street the upstairs wine shop is elegant and tasteful. Although we had a feeling Las Carboneras de Lu might be very very nice, we and our friends were in for a stunning gastronomic and visual treat. The downstairs restaurant could not be more beautiful, refined and romantic. From the bottles enclosed in the staircase to brick wine cellar motif to the soft lighting, we instantly sat down and said around the table, "This place is incredible!" And that's before the service started. And when the service did start, we instantly saw that no detail was left to chance. The staff was extremely well trained and politely attentive without being distracting. We were immediately served a salted edamame, followed by an excellent amuse bouche. We each shared a bottle of Pinot Noir Rose Cava, which was excellent. Lourdes, the co-owner recommended an excellent Madrid-area Ganache. And then the courses started to arrive. My wife shared the stuffed pasta (a thousand apologies to Lourdes and her husband that I don't know the exact name of each dish), while I shared the pate and foie gras plate. Both looked beautiful and were fantastic. Our friends ordered the boneless beef steak, which they couldn't stop raving about. I had the beef cheeks with root vegetables and it was amazing. My wife was served the suckling pig, which was cooked for a loving 9 hours. When she shared a bite, It was one of the best single bites of food I've ever had. My first thought was, "I'd fly back to Madrid just to have this single dish." It really was that good. Ending with dessert, my friend and I had the lemon pie, which was simply exquisite. So good, I forget what my wife had- my friend had ordered a lemon pie as well and we just couldn't stop talking about it. Throughout the evening, the staff could not have been more polite nor more professional. The ladies' dishes were simultaneously removed first, followed by the mens'. Every detail was attended to promptly and politely. We learned that Lourdes and her husband have been open a mere 5 months. They have done an absolutely amazing job with the restaurant and the wine shop. They are absolutely lovely people. If you are in Madrid and you appreciate fine dining, you have to treat yourself to their lovely restaurant. I hope this restaurant and the lovely founders have all the success in the world. You can tell they've poured themselves into Las Carboneras de Lu! Incredible.

title_review: Waited all night for incomplete orders.
review_preview: We had been in close contact with the restaurant in the days up to our meal yet they weren’t prepared for us at all. Our meal was at 9pm we arrived slightly early and there were 14 of us with about 10 other diners in...
review_full: We had been in close contact with the restaurant in the days up to our meal yet they weren’t prepared for us at all. Our meal was at 9pm we arrived slightly early and there were 14 of us with about 10 other diners in the restaurant. We ordered three options each which were Mexican style tapas. Long story short two of us still had no food two hours later with the rest of us served just one of our tapas. The two waiters weren't just standing around but seemed unable to get drinks or help us out in any kind of reasonable time. They explained the kitchen was just one person who made everything fresh but it took 4 hours to complete our meal and they have very simple food. The chef clearly had no prep done that day and started what he/she needed to do as orders came In. They gave no discount off the bill and no compensation by way of a drink and we didn’t get out of the restaurant till nearly 1am! When the food did come it wasn’t great and the mixed platters meant that we got confused and people didn’t get what they ordered or all of it. Very unimpressed.

We indulged in passionfruit and mango margaritas, both to die for. Then the chicken enchiladas in mole sauce, Every bit as good or perhaps better than the similar dish that mean Frontera Grill in Chicago world famous. Wonderful service as well from the owner, fluent in English, great atmosphere. Love this place!

title_review: Inventive, delicious food. Beautiful atmosphere. Must go!
review_preview: I stumbled onto Decadente with a few friends on accident —it happened to be right next to the hotel we were staying at. Often times trying out a random restaurant can lead to disappointing results, but that was not the experience this time. It was...
review_full: I stumbled onto Decadente with a few friends on accident —it happened to be right next to the hotel we were staying at. Often times trying out a random restaurant can lead to disappointing results, but that was not the experience this time. It was a fantastic choice . The host, Diego, easily found us a table in the packed dining room. He put us at ease with his charm and attentiveness. It was obvious that the whole staff strives to make their guests’ dining experience the best possible. The dining room is decorated with distressed wood, metals, interesting architectural features, and pleasantly low lighting. It was at the same time romantic and great for a group of friends.  Among other things we ordered croquetas de carabinero (fantastic!), torrenzo con su Corteza, and gambones crujientes (crunchy prawns). The chef clearly knew what he was doing with seasoning and ingredients representative of the region, and all of the plating was beautiful.  Definitely check out the downstairs ultra cool cocktail bar, which slightly resembles an old New York underground bar. It was cozy and intimate, and yet the whole restaurant is lively and fun.  Go here! You won’t regret it. I’ll definitelt be back next time I am in Madrid.

We got an outstanding bottle of resalte red wine which matched excellent ad was a bargain for the price.  Great vibe, will definitely come back!

review_preview: Had a great experience at this restaurant.  The best tapas we had in Madrid were here!  It's creative and modern cuisine.  We took the waiter's recommendation on two tapas, one of which was maybe pig ears (?) which may sound unappetizing, but were absolutely delicious,...
review_full: Had a great experience at this restaurant. The best tapas we had in Madrid were here! It's creative and modern cuisine. We took the waiter's recommendation on two tapas, one of which was maybe pig ears (?) which may sound unappetizing, but were absolutely delicious, and the spicy shrimp, which were what my husband said "the best shrimp he has ever eaten". We enjoyed it so much, we came back a second time. Unfortunately, we had a miss with the TBone, which had a really tough section that we couldn't even get our teeth through. Also, the cocktail bar that gets such good reviews was closed, since it was August, but the restaurant made some fantastic gin and tonics, which seem to be a specialty in Madrid. Wine selection was also fantastic. Highly recommend this restaurant. The Spicy Shrimp truly are what dreams are made of!
